info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 07 at 8:26PM CDT until July 07 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WHEELER AND COLLINGSWORTH COUNTIES... At 825 PM CDT, automated weather equipment reported severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Texola to 6 miles west of Vinson to 12 miles northeast of Childress, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Automated weather equipment reported 73 mph wind gust in Wellington at 8:18 PM CDT. IMPACT...Expect some tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Wellington, Dodson, Lutie and Samnorwood. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
